result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard Howard Cooley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (>1-5g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1r.
  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (>1-5g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1r.
  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (<=1g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1g.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: DOC collect   If discharged from extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

records.addlTxt:
IT IS ORDERED that the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision upon receipt of this order, determining the actual number of days served in Confinement and changing the remaining Confinement to Extended Supervision. The number of days that are converted from Confinement Time to Extended Supervision will be determined by a DOC records office staff member and will be based upon actual release Date.
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the Warden/Superintendent of the institution to which the prisoner is assigned shall effect his or her release upon receipt of this order.
from DOC
October 23, 2018 Sentencing hearing

Defendant Richard Howard Cooley in court in custody with attorney Peter A. Bartelt.  Mark Matthew Jahnke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Count 1 and 3 court orders 3 years 3 months prison and 4 years extended supervision each count . Count 4  court orders 2 years prison and 3 years extended supervision. All counts concurrent. Costs DOC collect. Sentence credit 161 days.

Defendant Richard Howard Cooley in court in custody with attorney Peter A. Bartelt.  Mark Matthew Jahnke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 23, 2018 at 03:00 pm.

Sentencing hearing on August 8, 2018 at 11:00 am.
Exhibit 1 Treatment Progress Report

Prosecuting Atty Cheniqua White appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Richard Howard Cooley in court with attorney Peter A. Bartelt. Sworn testimony from Tiffany Minguey. Court receives exhibit 1, Treatment progress report. Atty White presents argument. Atty Bartelt presents argument and requests motion be held in abeyance for 30 days. Court makes findings and orders defendant is terminated from drug court.Court orders bond is revoked, fees owed is converted to a civil judgment of $500.00, and matter is remanded to Branch 1. Defendant addresses the court.
